verses.verse: But now<WH6258> they that are younger<WH6810> <WH3117> than I have me in derision,<WH7832> whose<WH834> fathers<WH1> I would have disdained<WH3988> to have set<WH7896> with the dogs<WH3611> of my flock.<WH6629>
Yes,<WH1571> whereto<WH4100> might the strength<WH3581> of their hands<WH3027> profit me, in whom<WH5921> old age<WH3624> was perished?<WH6>
For want<WH2639> and famine<WH3720> they were solitary;<WH1565> fleeing<WH6207> into the wilderness<WH6723> in former<WH570> time<WH570> desolate<WH7722> and waste.<WH4875>
Who cut<WH6998> up mallows<WH4408> by the bushes,<WH7880> and juniper<WH7574> roots<WH8328> for their meat.<WH3899>
They were driven<WH1644> forth from among<WH1460> men, (they cried<WH7321> after<WH5921> them as after a thief;<WH1590>)
To dwell<WH7931> in the cliffs<WH6178> of the valleys,<WH5158> in caves<WH2356> of the earth,<WH6083> and in the rocks.<WH3710>
Among<WH996> the bushes<WH7880> they brayed;<WH5101> under<WH8478> the nettles<WH2738> they were gathered<WH5596> together.
They were children<WH1121> of fools,<WH5036> yes,<WH1571> children<WH1121> of base<WH1097> <WH8034> men: they were viler<WH5217> than<WH4480> the earth.<WH776>
And now<WH6258> am I their song,<WH5058> yes, I am their byword.<WH4405>
They abhor<WH8581> me, they flee<WH7368> far<WH7350> from me, and spare<WH2820> not to spit<WH7536> in my face.<WH6440>
Because<WH3588> he has loosed<WH6605> my cord,<WH3499> and afflicted<WH6031> me, they have also let loose<WH7971> the bridle<WH7448> before<WH6440> me.
On my right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> rise<WH6965> the youth;<WH6526> they push<WH7971> away my feet,<WH7272> and they raise<WH5549> up against<WH5921> me the ways<WH734> of their destruction.<WH343>
They mar<WH5420> my path,<WH5410> they set forward<WH3276> my calamity,<WH1942> they have no<WH3808> helper.<WH5826>
They came<WH857> on me as a wide<WH7342> breaking<WH6556> in of waters: in the desolation<WH7722> they rolled<WH1556> themselves on me.
Terrors<WH1091> are turned<WH2015> on me: they pursue<WH7291> my soul<WH5082> as the wind:<WH7307> and my welfare<WH3444> passes<WH5674> away as a cloud.<WH5645>
And now<WH6258> my soul<WH5315> is poured<WH8210> out on me; the days<WH3117> of affliction<WH6040> have taken<WH270> hold<WH270> on me.
My bones<WH6106> are pierced<WH5365> in me in the night<WH3915> season: and my sinews<WH6207> take<WH7901> no<WH3808> rest.<WH7901>
By the great<WH7227> force<WH3581> of my disease is my garment<WH3830> changed:<WH2664> it binds<WH247> me about<WH247> as the collar<WH6310> of my coat.<WH3801>
He has cast<WH3384> me into the mire,<WH2563> and I am become<WH4911> like<WH4911> dust<WH6083> and ashes.<WH665>
I cry<WH7768> to you, and you do not hear<WH6030> me: I stand<WH5975> up, and you regard<WH995> me not.
You are become<WH2015> cruel<WH393> to me: with your strong<WH6108> hand<WH3027> you oppose<WH7852> yourself against me.
You lift<WH5375> me up to the wind;<WH7307> you cause me to ride<WH7392> on it, and dissolve<WH4127> my substance.<WH7738>
For I know<WH3045> that you will bring<WH7725> me to death,<WH4194> and to the house<WH1004> appointed<WH4150> for all<WH3605> living.<WH2416>
However, he will not stretch<WH7971> out his hand<WH3027> to the grave,<WH1164> though<WH518> they cry<WH7769> in his destruction.<WH6365>
Did not I weep<WH1058> for him that was in trouble?<WH7186> was not my soul<WH5315> grieved<WH5701> for the poor?<WH34>
When<WH3588> I looked<WH6960> for good,<WH2896> then evil<WH7451> came<WH935> to me: and when I waited<WH3176> for light,<WH216> there came<WH935> darkness.<WH652>
My bowels<WH4578> boiled,<WH7570> and rested<WH1826> not: the days<WH3117> of affliction<WH6040> prevented<WH6923> me.
I went<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> without<WH3808> the sun:<WH2535> I stood<WH6965> up, and I cried<WH7768> in the congregation.<WH6951>
I am a brother<WH251> to dragons,<WH8577> and a companion<WH7453> to owls.<WH1323> <WH3284>
My skin<WH5785> is black<WH7835> on me, and my bones<WH6106> are burned<WH2787> with heat.<WH2721>
My harp<WH3658> also is turned to mourning,<WH60> and my organ<WH5748> into the voice<WH6963> of them that weep.<WH1058>
